item.title: Encouraging the International Olympic Committee to select New York City as the site of the 2012 Olympic Games.

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. (text of measure as introduced: CR S8566)

summary.text:
Encourages the International Olympic Committee to choose New York City as the site of the 2012 Olympic Games.

Expresses the hope that the United States will be selected as the host country of such Games and pledges cooperation and support for their successful fulfillment in the highest Olympic tradition.

bill.title: A concurrent resolution encouraging the International Olympic Committee to select New York City as the site of the 2012 Olympic Games.

item.title: A concurrent resolution encouraging the International Olympic Committee to select New York City as the site of the 2012 Olympic Games.
A concurrent resolution encouraging the International Olympic Committee to select New York City as the site of the 2012 Olympic Games.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. (text of measure as introduced: CR S8566)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
